conclusion: Need to find the propagation time of light in the prism.
Understanding the geometry of the prism and path of light.
Prism has vertex angle θ = 30°, base AB has side length L, light enters at midpoint O of AB at incident angle i = 45°, exits perpendicular to AC.
Drawing a diagram to visualize the path of light.
Isosceles prism with sides AC and BC equal, base AB is the bottom side.
Label points: A is apex, B and C are endpoints of base, O is midpoint of AB, AO = OB = L/2.
Light enters at point O on base AB at 45° to the base.
Finding path of light inside the prism.
Light exits perpendicular to AC, leaves at right angle to AC.
Need to find angle γ between base AB and line from O to exit point.
Right angle marked where light exits perpendicular to AC.
Finding path length and speed of light in prism to find time.
Speed of light in prism is v = c / n, where n is refractive index.
Using Snell's law to find refractive index.
At entrance point O, light enters at incident angle of 45°, refractive angle is r.
Using Snell's law: sin(i) = n_prism * sin(r), sin(45°) = n_prism * sin(r), √2/2 = n_prism * sin(r).
sin(r) = (√2 / 2) / n_prism, need another way to find r.
Considering geometry of prism.
Isosceles prism with vertex angle θ = 30°, angles at base B and C are 75°.
Point O is midpoint of AB, angle at O is symmetric.
Finding path from O to exit point.
Angle at E between ray and AC is 90°.
Finding path length from O to E inside prism.
